title: I follow the children.
body:
I follow the children

I watch them play

I watch them get killed when

A car drove that day

The car is still running

It speeds with its might

The man is still gunning

Then drives out of sight

I looked at this strange poem written in chalk. I got out of my car and went for a walk. How could children draw a story so grim? Public shootings are common, the world is quite dim. We need to ban guns or take them off market. The only wisdom ever spoken from the red carpet.

I read on and on. The story did prolong. I got to a part where something felt wrong:

I follow the children

I follow the car

I felt a chill when

I didn't get far

I bumped my head

On a TV screen

This entire time led

To a police station scene

I was watching on tape

The events all unfold

My mouth was agape

Since the story it told

Was about a man in a car

Who shot kids for fun

That man, whose the star

Was I the same one?

Asked questions all day

They told me the facts

They said I will stay

Until I payed for my acts

It was at this point in the story. Where I have had all the glory. This poem was about me. I chuckled and giggled with glee.

The court found me guilty

The court made me serve

Now my heart feels all silky

Its what I deserve

I sit down unseen

They pull out a syringe

A lethal vaccine

And I start to cringe

My life feels so hollow

It all ends this way

The children I'll follow

With children I'll stay

I finish the poem. I feel like I know him. I sit still and wait. For the pain it creates. As soon as it does, I feel it. The needle went in, they seal it.

I woke up with fear. The dream felt so near. I turn on my phone and see. To see if my dream lied to me.

I see a story on Google news. It has over 10 million views. A car drove by my childhood street. I asked around people I never did meet.

When they saw who I was they panicked and yelled. I would not believe the story they telled. I was a set of twin brothers. It was a secret of my mother's. I felt a connection in his last hour. It was due to what you'd call twin power.

I went home after the press. Asked me questions I digress. All about my unknown twin. And the violence that took place within.

I lay in my bed as thoughts start to chase. I look to my right and see my gun case. I know he brought me shame. But perhaps we are the same.

I look out the window pane. I see kids playing some silly game. I go outside. I walk with a glide. There is something I hold. It is metal and cold.

And I do what I was told.

I follow the children.
author: Kaladad9893
